text: "Gotta erhalte Franz den Kaiser" (, meaning "God Save Francis the Emperor") was the national anthem of Austria-Hungary. It was sometimes known as the "Kaiserhymne" (). It was a personal hymn for Emperor Francis II of the Holy Roman Empire. The words of the song were written by Lorenz Leopold Haschka in 1797, and in that same year, the music was composed by the famous musician Joseph Haydn. The melody would later be used in other songs, such as "Deutschlandlied", the German national anthem. After the empire broke up, the hymn was later replaced by "DeutschÃ¶sterreich, du herrliches Land" in Austria, and "Himnusz" in Hungary. Due to the popularity of the anthem, it has been translated into many different languages, including Hungarian, Czech, Croatian, Polish, Romanian, Italian, English, Slovene, Banat Romanian, Ukrainian, and Friulian. ==Lyrics== ===German original=== ====1797 version==== Words of the song in German Translation of these words into English Gott erhalte Franz den Kaiser, Unsern guten Kaiser Franz! Lange lebe Franz, der Kaiser, In des GlÃ¼ckes hellstem Glanz! Ihm erblÃ¼hen Lorbeerreiser, Wo er geht, zum Ehrenkranz! Gott erhalte Franz den Kaiser, Unsern guten Kaiser Franz! LaÃŸ von seiner Fahne Spitzen Strahlen Sieg und Fruchtbarkeit! LaÃŸ in seinem Rate Sitzen Weisheit, Klugheit, Redlichkeit; Und mit Seiner Hoheit Blitzen Schalten nur Gerechtigkeit! Gott erhalte Franz den Kaiser, Unsern guten Kaiser Franz! StrÃ¶me deiner Gaben FÃ¼lle Ãœber ihn, sein Haus und Reich! Brich der Bosheit Macht, enthÃ¼lle Jeden Schelm- und Bubenstreich! Dein Gesetz sei stets sein Wille, Dieser uns Gesetzen gleich. Gott erhalte Franz den Kaiser, Unsern guten Kaiser Franz! Froh erleb' er seiner Lande, Seiner VÃ¶lker hÃ¶chsten Flor! Seh' sie, Eins durch Bruderbande, Ragen allen andern vor! Und vernehm' noch an dem Rande SpÃ¤ter Gruft der Enkel Chor. Gott erhalte Franz den Kaiser, Unsern guten Kaiser Franz! God keep Francis the Emperor, Our good emperor Francis! Long live Francis the emperor, In the brightest splendour of happiness! May sprigs of laurel bloom for him As a garland of honour, wherever he goes. God keep Francis the Emperor, Our good emperor Francis! From the tips of his flag May victory and fruitfulness shine! In his council May knowledge, wisdom and honesty sit! And with his Highness's lightning May justice but prevail! God keep Francis the Emperor, Our good emperor Francis! May the abundance of thy gifts Pour over him, his house and Empire! Break the power of wickedness, and reveal Every trick of rogues and knaves! May thy Law always be his Will, And may this be like laws to us. God keep Francis the Emperor, Our good emperor Francis! May he gladly experience the highest bloom Of his land and of his peoples! May he see them, united by the bonds of brothers, Loom over all others! And may he hear at the edge Of his late tomb his grandchildren's chorus. God keep Francis the Emperor, Our good emperor Francis! ====1854 version==== In 1854, the words of the song was changed by Johann Gabriel Seidl. Segen sei dem Land beschieden, und sein Ruhm dem Segen gleich: ğ„† Gottes Sonne strahl' in Frieden auf ein glÃ¼cklich Ã–sterreich! ğ„‡ LaÃŸt uns fest zusammenhalten, In der Eintracht liegt die Macht; Mit vereinter KrÃ¤fte Walten Wird das Schwere leicht vollbracht, LaÃŸt uns Eins durch BrÃ¼derbande Gleichem Ziel entgegengehn! ğ„† Heil dem Kaiser, Heil dem Lande, Ã–sterreich wird ewig stehn! ğ„‡ An des Kaisers Seite waltet, Ihm verwandt durch Stamm und Sinn, Reich an Reiz, der nie veraltet, Unsâ€™re holde Kaiserin. Was als GlÃ¼ck zu hÃ¶chst gepriesen StrÃ¶mâ€™ auf sie der Himmel aus: ğ„† Heil Franz Josef, Heil Elisen, Segen Habsburgs ganzem Haus! ğ„‡ God preserve, God protect, Our Emperor, our Country! Powerful through the support of the Faith, He leads us with a wise hand! Let us defend the Crown of his fathers, Shielding it from every foe. ğ„† Forever with the Habsburg Throne, Austria's fate remains united. ğ„‡ Devout and honest, true and open, Let us stand for right and duty! Let us, if needed, with joyous Hope, Go courageously in the battle! Mindful of the laurel wreaths, That the army so often wove itself. ğ„† Treasure and Blood for Our Emperor, Treasure and Blood for Our Fatherland! ğ„‡ What was wrought by the diligence of citizens, may the soldierâ€™s power faithfully protect! With cheery weapons of mind, Arts and Science may triumph! Blessings be granted into the Land, And its fame match the blessings. ğ„† Godâ€™s sunshine in peace, On a happy Austria! ğ„‡ Let us always stand together, For unity there is power! With our combined strength, The difficult is easily overcome! Let us, brotherly united, Go towards the same goal. ğ„† Hail to the Emperor, Hail to the Empire, Austria will forever stand! ğ„‡ At the side of Emperor prevails, Related to him by descent and mind! Rich in charm that never becames outdated, Our gracious empress! What is praised as luck most highly, Heaven pour on them! ğ„† Hail to Franz Joseph, Hail to Elisabeth, Blessing to the entire House of Habsburg! ğ„‡ ===Hungarian version=== :Tartsa Isten, Ã³vja Isten :KirÃ¡lyunk s a kÃ¶zhazÃ¡t! :ErÅ‘t lelve a szent hitben :Ossza bÃ¶lcs parancsszavÃ¡t! :Hadd vÃ©dnÃ¼nk Å‘s koronÃ¡jÃ¡t :BÃ¡rhonnÃ©t fenyÃ­tse vÃ©sz! :Magyar honnal Habsburg trÃ³njÃ¡t :EgyesÃ­tÃ© Ã©gi kÃ©z ===Czech version=== ===Croatian version=== ===Polish version=== ===Slovene version=== ==Adaptations== *The alma mater of Columbia University, "Stand, Columbia" *The alma mater of the University of Pittsburgh *The alma mater of Western Reserve University ==References== Category:Historical anthems Category:Austria-Hungary Category:European anthems Category:1790s songs
